definition: humanism/humanitarian (aid)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: There are also humanitarian uses for sniffer bees.
sentences.chinese: 嗅探蜂還能應用於人道主義援助。

sentences.english: Nobility and dignity of people is the core values of humanitarian.
sentences.chinese: 人的高貴和尊嚴是人道主義的核心價值。

sentences.english: Which you agreed to do, being the humanitarian sort you are.
sentences.chinese: 這你也同意了，作爲一個像你這樣的人道主義者。

sentences.english: In the value system of legal social work, the key idea is humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 在法律社會工作價值體系中，其核心理念是人道主義。

sentences.english: Both of these two types of humanitarianism are responsible for the chaotic situation in education and society.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種人道主義要爲教育和社會領域的混亂無序負責。

sentences.english: These humanitarians often brave great danger, far from home.
sentences.chinese: 人道主義工作者往往冒着極大的危險，遠離家庭。

sentences.english: They come from the arts and a humanitarian educational background.
sentences.chinese: 他們都是文科出生，並且受過人道主義教育。

sentences.english: Last year the court indicted the minister for humanitarian affairs in the Sudanese government, together with a janjaweed leader.
sentences.chinese: 去年法庭起訴了蘇丹政府的人道主義事務部部長。

sentences.english: In reality, the word humanism has two very different meanings.
sentences.chinese: 說實在話，人道主義有兩種完全不同的意義。

sentences.english: I am on the staff of CBN, a humanitarian organization.
sentences.chinese: “我們是一個人道主義組織”，賈馬爾說。

sentences.english: I solemnly pledge myself to devote my life to the service of humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我莊重地宣誓要把我的一生獻給人道主義事業。

sentences.english: All these explain the humanism spirit hiding deep in Jin Yong's heart.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些都說明了金庸深藏於心底的人道主義精神。

sentences.english: The supporters of the Gaza-bound aid flotilla had more than humanitarian intentions.
sentences.chinese: 加沙救援船隊的支持者的動機遠不止於人道主義。

sentences.english: We will extend our persistence in deer collagen to the humanistic cause.
sentences.chinese: 我們將會把鹿膠原蛋白的執着延伸到人道主義事業。

sentences.english: You love falling in love with the ideals of humanitarian concepts.
sentences.chinese: 你愛愛上了人道主義概念的理想。

sentences.english: He objected to severe punishment and thought that criminal penalty should be accoding to humanitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 反對重刑酷罰，主張並實踐刑罰人道主義等。

definition: variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
liberalism
to appeal/to demand (an answer)/requirement/demand/claim/appeal/(marketing) message
zeal/enthusiasm/ardor/enthusiastic/warmhearted
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
non-governmental organization (NGO)
duty/responsibility/obligation
to attach importance to sth/to value
disadvantaged social groups (e.g. the handicapped)/the economically and politically marginalized/the dispossessed
human rights
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
feasible/realistic/practical/earnestly/conscientiously
nonprofit organization
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
for this reason/with regards to this/in this respect/in order to do this/to this end
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
